TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed IsolationLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the isolation level of a transaction.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The data affected by a transaction is called volatile. When you create a transaction, you can specify the isolation level that applies to the transaction. The isolation level of a transaction determines what level of access other transactions have to volatile data before a transaction completes.
The lowest isolation level, `ReadUncommitted`, allows many transactions to operate on a data store simultaneously and provides no protection against data corruption due to interruptive transactions. The highest isolation level, `Serializable`, provides a high degree of protection against interruptive transactions, but requires that each transaction complete before any other transactions are allowed to operate on the data.
The isolation level of a transaction is determined when the transaction is created. By default, the <xref:System.Transactions> infrastructure creates `Serializable` transactions. You can determine the isolation level of an existing transaction using the <xref:System.Transactions.Transaction.IsolationLevel%2A> property of a transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel Chaos = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The pending changes from more highly isolated transactions cannot be overwritten.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel ReadCommitted = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Volatile data cannot be read during the transaction, but can be modified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel ReadUncommitted = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Volatile data can be read and modified during the transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel RepeatableRead = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified during the transaction. New data can be added during the transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel Serializable = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Volatile data can be read but not modified, and no new data can be added during the transaction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel Snapshot = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Volatile data can be read. Before a transaction modifies data, it verifies if another transaction has changed the data after it was initially read. If the data has been updated, an error is raised. This allows a transaction to get to the previously committed value of the data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you try to promote a transaction that was created with this isolation level, an T:System.InvalidOperationException?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=True is thrown with the error message "Transactions with IsolationLevel Snapshot cannot be promoted".

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Transactions.IsolationLevel Unspecified = int32(6)

Docs.summary: A different isolation level than the one specified is being used, but the level cannot be determined. An exception is thrown if this value is set.
